Water Storage and Retrieval 
Water to be used for drinking and cooking should be stored in a clean, large-
mouthed vessel. The vessel should be covered properly. For taking out water, a 
ladle with a long handle should be used and kept on the cover of the vessel for 
easy and ready access. One should be careful not to dip hands in the water for drinking or cooking. The ladle should be cleaned daily. For people 
living in arsenic 
and fluoride-
affected areas, 
one must check 
with the water 
supplier if the 
drinking water 
is safe•
44
It is important to always drink water in a clean glass. If the hands are used for 
drinking, care must be taken to wash the hands with soap and water before 
drinking. Washing children’s hands is very important.  No one should be allowed 
to drink from the ladle.
